thread.title: Toronto Blue Jays and Texas Rangers head to extras in crucial ALDS Game 2
thread.title_full: Toronto Blue Jays and Texas Rangers head to extras in crucial ALDS Game 2 - The Globe and Mail

author: Globe Staff
title: Toronto Blue Jays and Texas Rangers head to extras in crucial ALDS Game 2
text:
A A The Toronto Blue Jays face off against the Texas Rangers in Game 2 of the ALDS on Friday afternoon at the Rogers Centre. The Rangers beat the Jays 5-3 in Game 1 on Thursday.
Today's score: 4-4 in the 11th inning
(John Lehmann/The Globe and Mail) Take a look at photos from today's game from Globe photographers
Tweets from https://twitter.com/arikligeti/lists/jays-globe
What you need to know:
– Both Josh Donaldson and Jose Bautista will be playing today for the Jays despite leaving yesterday’s game with injuries.
– Adrian Beltre of the Rangers will not play.
– Starting pitchers: for the Jays, Marcus Stroman (who has an awesome Instagram account ); for the Rangers, Cole Hamels. (Neither pitcher has faced the other team this year.)
– In the history of the wild-card era, which dates back to the 1995 season, only four teams have come back from down 2-0 in the Division Series.
– Wherever you're watching the game, send us your photos on Twitter or Instagram using #GlobeJays
– Go here for the full recap of Game 1.
Where fans are cheering on the Jays:
